extendedIngredients.name: cayenne pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: pinch cayenne pepper, optional and to taste

extendedIngredients.name: cilantro leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: cilantro leaves from about 1/2 bunch of cilantro, torn or chopped (I used 1 whole bunch)

extendedIngredients.name: corn chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: chips or bread for serving, optional

extendedIngredients.name: fresh corn
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup corn (fresh or frozen; I don't cook or thaw it)

extendedIngredients.name: jalapeno pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 average/small de-seeded jalape√±o pepper, diced finely (or keep the seeds for extra heat)

extendedIngredients.name: jelly
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup hot pepper jelly (homemade here or here, Trader Joe's, or your favorite)
metaInformation: ( here or here, Trader Joe's, or )

extendedIngredients.name: juice of lime
extendedIngredients.originalString: juice from 1 very juicy lime, 3 to 4 tablespoons

extendedIngredients.name: pineapple
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3/4 cup diced pineapple (fresh, frozen, or canned)

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: salt and pepper, optional and to taste

extendedIngredients.name: zucchini
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small zucchini, diced small (about 1 to 1 1/2 cups)

recipes.title: Sweet and Sour Zucchini Corn Salad (vegan, GF)
recipes.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, toss very well to coat, and serve immediately. Optionally, refrigerate salad for up to 24 hours before serving. Fruits and vegetables will release their juices and salad will be juicier, but the flavors will have married and salad tastes better on second day. Salad will keep airtight in the fridge for up to 4 days, noting it will become juicier as time passes.

steps.step: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, toss very well to coat, and serve immediately. Optionally, refrigerate salad for up to 24 hours before serving. Fruits and vegetables will release their juices and salad will be juicier, but the flavors will have married and salad tastes better on second day. Salad will keep airtight in the fridge for up to 4 days, noting it will become juicier as time passes.
